intro: Schizolaena gereaui, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture and produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Schizolaena gereaui is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins. Its latex contains toxic compounds, making it unpalatable to herbivores.
